title: Gaza crisis: Israel and Hamas agree to 72-hour ceasefire - as it happened | World news | The Guardian
summary: all sides agree to ceasefire plan .
new talk of ceasefire deal in egypt .
human rights watch : israeli troops killed civilians trying to flee violence in khuza'a .
netanyahu : 'we have no intention of attacking the residents of gaza '

text: we 're going to wrap up our live coverage for the day .
here 's a summary of where things stand : israel , hamas and other palestinian factions said they had agreed to a 72-hour ceasefire to begin tuesday at 8am local time ( 0500 gmt ) .
egypt crafted the proposal .
cairo invited delegations from each side to begin face-to-face talks tuesday .
the announcement came after another day of strikes in gaza , including one on a home in shati refugee camp that killed an eight-year-old girl .
israeli authorities reported two terrorist attacks in jerusalem on monday .
an excavator operator ran over a man , killing him , and tipped over a bus before being shot dead by police .
separately , a suspect shot and wounded a man .
palestinian search crews recovered 32 bodies during a ceasefire window declared by israel monday , the health ministry said .
an additional 18 gazans were killed on monday , it said .
the unrwa spokesman says the number of displaced gazans is almost 273,000 .
the israeli military says 63 rockets fired from gaza hit israel on monday .
there were no reports of injuries .
spain said it was suspending arms sales to israel and britain said it was reviewing arms export licenses to israel .
an iranian official said missile technology transfers from tehran to gaza had enabled the hamas war effort .
human rights watch described three incidents it said it was investigating as possible war crimes committed by israeli soldiers in gaza .
spain has suspended arms sales to israel over the bloodshed in gaza , el pais reports .
haaretz up on the report : spain is the second country to announce sanctions over arms sale to israel in the past 24 hours , after britain said it was reviewing all arms export licenses to israel .
a similar move was taken by the british government after operation cast lead in 2009 .
the decision to freeze weapons exports from spain to israel was reached on thursday , during a session of the inter-ministerial committee on arms manufacturing .
[ ] arms exports from spain to israel are fairly limited .
in 2013 , weapons sale was 5 million euro - 1 percent of all spanish security exports .

documents.title: all sides agree to ceasefire plan
text: hamas told egypt a short while ago of its acceptance of a 72-hour period of calm , '' hamas spokesman sami abu zuhri told reuters .
they 're to meet in cairo .
the planned start of the ceasefire , 8am local time , is just under 8 hours away .
it 's 12.21am in gaza .

'looks like the real deal , ' says an unnamed us official quoted by the wall street journal : jay solomon ( @ wsjsolomon ) u.s. official : new israel-hamas ceasefire deal in # gaza , `` looks like the real deal . ''
reuters echoes the bbc report that a hamas spokesman says the group has agreed to the egyptian proposal for a 72-hour ceasefire .
there is a lack of a clear signal as to whether hamas is aboard for the 72-hour ceasefire to begin tuesday .
nbc reports that hamas tv in gaza is not running with the news : richard engel ( @ richardengel ) hamas tv in gaza not talking abt ceasefire deal .

some pan arab stations running it as breaking news now but bbc correspondent paul danahar reports assent in doha : paul danahar ( @ pdanahar ) hamas spokesman in doha says hamas has accepted the 72 hour ceasefire
israel has agreed to the egyptian ceasefire proposal , reuters reports .

israel has accepted the egyptian proposal for a ceasefire to begin tuesday , haaretz reports : barak ravid ( @ barakravid ) breaking : israeli official : cabinet ministers were updated that israel accepts the egyptian proposal for a 72 hours ceasefire starting 8am this follows earlier reports that the palestinian factions had voted to support the proposal .

hamas and israel appeared closer to a ceasefire late on monday night , after a senior egyptian official said that there were strong indicators that the parties concerned accepted the egyptian invitation to a 72-hour ceasefire starting at 8am local time '' , reports the guardian 's patrick kingsley ( @ patrickkingsley ) in cairo : the notice followed two days of negotiations in cairo between a united palestinian faction and egyptian intelligence officials , who have been in close contact throughout the conflict with their israeli counterparts .
the egyptian source told the guardian that following a successful ceasefire , all sides would come immediately to cairo for formal talks .
a representative of palestinian islamic jihad , a hamas ally , told the guardian that personally i 'm expecting to reach a ceasefire in the next few hours . ''
we are [ now ] waiting for procedures that will be handled by cairo , '' said ziad al-nakhala , deputy secretary-general of palestinian islamic jihad , who was present during negotiations .

the palestinian authority 's ambassador to cairo , gamal shobky , who also attended , said : until now there is no result in the work for the ceasefire - but i hope from tomorrow there will be for a ceasefire for at least 72 hours . ''
israel was not present at the negotiations , but has been in close contact with egyptian intelligence all month .

a senior iranian official on monday attributed hamas ' ability to fire missiles at israel to tehran 's efforts to provide missile technology to hamas , ap reports : officials from iran 's powerful revolutionary guards have said in the past that fajr-5 missiles are part of hamas ' gaza strip arsenal , whose technology has been supplied by iran and produced locally without needing direct shipment .

palestinian resistance missiles are the blessings of iran 's transfer of technology , '' the secretary of the expediency discernment council , mohsen rezaei , was quoted as saying by al-alam , the arabic channel of iran 's state tv .
we need to transfer defensive and military technology to palestinians so that they can build weapons under the blockade and defend themselves , '' he added .
rezaei , a former revolutionary guard chief commander , wrote to president hassan rouhani this week calling on him to provide air defense systems to hamas to hit invading israeli planes .
he also said hamas should dig tunnels to be used as shelter to protect gaza 's population from israeli assaults .

i 've requested rouhani to provide air defense systems to gaza so that palestinians can defend themselves against invading planes , '' he said , adding that iran was not shy to publicly declare its military support for hamas .
in an update , the israeli military says 63 rockets fired from gaza have hit israel on monday , and an additional five rockets were intercepted by iron dome .
there were no reports of injuries .
israel will send a delegation to cairo tuesday , haaretz reports : barak ravid ( @ barakravid ) royal flip flop by netanyahu & cabinet .
friday they decided not to talk about ceasefire anymore .

tomorrow they will send delegation to cairo gershon baskin ( @ gershonbaskin ) seems to me that netanyahu may have decided it is good for israel to leave hamas in power.how does this mesh with statements of last month ?

documents.title: new talk of ceasefire deal in egypt
text: haaretz has reported that palestinian factions in talks in cairo - israel is said not to have a delegation present - have agreed to accept the new cease-fire draft presented by israel , and will lay down their weapons at 8 a.m. on tuesday morning . ''
the report is via jack khoury .
and reuters adds a snap : egypt has strong indications from israel and palestinians that they will accept a 72-hour ceasefire starting 8am local time tuesday .

- egyptian sources '' the guardian 's patrick kingsley is in cairo ( pij = palestinian islamic jihad ) : patrick kingsley ( @ patrickkingsley ) pij rep in cairo , following today 's talks : `` personally i 'm expecting to reach a ceasefire in the next few hours . ''
# gaza

here 's some background on today 's excavator attack in jerusalem , via reuters : internal security minister yitzhak aharonovitch said the nearly four-week-old gaza war had raised fears of attacks in israeli cities .

from the moment fighting started in the south , we realised such an incident of a lone attacker can happen , and such tractor attacks are familiar in jerusalem , '' aharonovitch said on channel 2 television .
[ the driver 's ] whole family is being interrogated .
we want to know who sent him , if he was acting alone , whether he belonged to a network - all those things are being checked , '' he said .
in two incidents in july 2008 , construction vehicles driven by palestinians hit israeli buses and pedestrians , killing a total of three people .
in both incidents , the attackers were shot dead .
three years later , an arab truck driver drove into cars and pedestrians in tel aviv , killing one person , in what police said was a deliberate attack .
the driver was apprehended and sentenced to life imprisonment .

the unrwa spokesman says the number of displaced gazans is almost 273,000 : chris gunness ( @ chrisgunness ) # gaza 's human displacement catastrophe continues to grow with 272,987 people in 90 unrwa schools , an average of 3,033 per shelter rt

the attacks on un schools sheltering people fleeing bombardment have reverberated around the world , '' writes the guardian 's harriet sherwood ( @ harrietsherwood ) , with unusually strong condemnation from washington , and un demands for an international inquiry into 'gross violations of international law ' '' : the most recent attack , on sunday , was described by the un secretary general , ban ki-moon , as a moral outrage and a criminal act '' .

israel , however , has accused hamas and other militant groups of firing rockets from positions close to un premises , and the un has made three separate discoveries of weapons caches in its schools .
each time the un has clearly denounced such use of its buildings as a flagrant violation '' of its neutrality .
on top of the shelling and rocket fire and the accompanying war of words , 11 un workers have been killed in the four-week conflict , including at least five teachers and a school principal .
the un says 95 of its installations in gaza have been damaged since the start of the conflict , in 135 strikes that include at least 10 direct hits .
read the full piece here .

guardian washington bureau chief dan roberts is watching the white house daily briefing : dan roberts ( @ robertsdan ) `` the nature of our relationship is strong and unchanged '' says white house @ twitterid when asked if us is frustrated with israel .
as is the bbc 's paul danahar : paul danahar ( @ pdanahar ) white house : israel can & should do more to live up to those standards [ to protect civilians in gaza war ] ''
our latest news story can be found here : israel resumes attacks on gaza , ending self-declared ceasefire , '' by jerusalem correspondent harriet sherwood ( @ harrietsherwood ) .
in addition to reports found in this blog , harriet reports : palestinian officials said an israeli airstrike hit a target next to a desalination plant , killing two people and wounding 16 .
police detained 12 palestinians overnight who it said were involved in rioting '' near the old city .
protests in east jerusalem and the west bank over the war in gaza in recent weeks have resulted in at least 10 palestinians killed by israeli security forces .
[ ] as diplomats prepared for talks in cairo , the funeral took place of hadar goldin , a 23-year-old soldier who israel said had been captured by hamas during an attack near rafah on friday .

[ ] praising the soldier as a great hero '' , israeli prime minister binyamin netanyahu told his parents : i hope that you will find consolation in the fact that he fell to uphold the people of israel in the struggle for our independence . ''
read the full story here .

documents.title: human rights watch : israeli troops killed civilians trying to flee violence in khuza'a
text: human rights watch is investigating reports of israeli soldiers firing on unarmed civilians who were trying to flee destruction in khuza'a a week and a half ago .

israeli forces in the southern gaza town of khuza'a fired on and killed civilians in apparent violation of the laws of war in several incidents between july 23 and 25 , 2014 , '' the group says in a report .
deliberate attacks on civilians who are not participating in the fighting are war crimes . ''
the report describes three incidents .

from the description of the first incident : on the morning of july 23 , israeli forces ordered a group of about 100 palestinians in khuza'a to leave a home in which they had gathered to take shelter , family members said .
the first member to leave the house , shahid al-najjar , had his hands up but an israeli soldier shot him in the jaw , seriously injuring him .
[ ] as one group walked unarmed to khan younis , israeli soldiers fired on them , killing one and wounding two others .
from the description of the second incident : israeli soldiers fired on a group of civilians who had been told to leave their home in khuza'a , killing mohammed al-najjar , a witness said .

from the description of the third incident : on july 25 , an israeli strike killed three civilians - motassem al-najjar , 5 ; kamel al-najjar , 62 ; and salim qdeih , around 70 - who were among 120 people sheltering in the basement of a home , witnesses said .
[ ] those who had survived the attack on the basement fled after the strike and walked to khan younis , carrying white flags and raising their hands when they came across israeli soldiers .
an israeli missile strike hit one group of them , killing a man and wounding his cousin , the cousin told human rights watch .
the israeli military has not issued a response to the report .
israeli soldiers walk by foot near the border between israel and gaza on august 4 , 2014 .
cohen magen/afp/getty images an israeli soldier gestures in relief near the border after returning from gaza on august 4 , 2014 .
cohen magen/afp/getty images
as our live blog coverage continues , here 's a summary of where things stand : violence in gaza continued monday , with windows of relative calm during a 7-hour ceasefire declared by israel .
a morning strike on a home in shati refugee camp killed a girl , 8 , and wounded 29 , medics said .
search crews recovered 32 bodies during the ceasefire window , the health ministry said .
an additional 18 gazans were killed on monday , it said .
the israeli military reported that 53 rockets had been fired at israel monday .
there were no reports of injuries .
there were reports of two attacks in jerusalem monday .
in one incident ( video ) a man driving an excavator overturned a bus and ran over a victim , killing one , before being shot dead .
the second incident , a reported shooting , left one victim hospitalized and a suspect at large .
netanyahu said the campaign in gaza is continuing '' and we have no intention of attacking the residents of gaza '' .
1,865 palestinians - an estimated 80 % of them civilians - have died in the conflict , the health ministry said , with 9,470 wounded .
french foreign minister laurent fabius said israel 's right to security does not justify the killing of children and the massacre of civilians '' .
palestinian groups met in egypt to discuss the terms of a potential ceasefire , but the talks went on without a representative from israel .
hamas leader khaled meshaal said any lasting ceasefire depends on the blockade of gaza being lifted .
here is footage of the excavator attack , taken from multiple vantages , via the telegraph :

dr belal dabour from the shifa hospital in gaza spoke to the guardian 's mona mahmood ( @ monamood ) about the harrowing conditions patients and medical staff face daily : the death toll has climbed to 1,840 victims and 10,000 wounded , up until sunday .
just yesterday , we received more than 400 victims , 25 % of them were dead by the end of the day .
our main concern now is how to move the victims of the unrwa school in rafah to our hospital .
all the roads that connect us with rafah are blocked by the israeli army .
they used to share their load with the shifa and khan younis hospitals but they ca n't do that any more .
the mortuary in rafah hospital is small , they are using fridges normally used for food and ice cream to store bodies .
there are 20 doctors and 20 nurses in the emergency unit in shifa for every single shift .
a few volunteer doctors came from the west bank , ramallah and nablus to give a hand , others came from relief organizations from jordan .
there are 13 beds on each floor in the hospital , but these are totally insufficient .
the mortuary 's capacity is 16 to 18 bodies - we have to stack the bodies two to a shelf now .
sometimes , you can see bodies on the floor for lack of space .
we ask the families to take their relatives ' bodies immediately .
a few people had to bring beds from home and keep their wounded relatives in hospital 's corridors .
if you come to the hospital theatre , you will find two beds with two medical teams working at the same time .
sometimes , we have to do 50 operations in a day .
we had 10 operating rooms working till dawn during the last massacre in shuja'yia market .
most of the operations are for removing shrapnel , sewing wounds , amputations or fractures .
because we do not have enough beds to keep the operated victims , even if they undergo major operations we have to send them home despite the high risk .
we are all exhausted physically and spiritually but we have to keep some sort of cohesion to help people .
me and my other colleagues have not received our salaries for eight months now , but we recently got $ 300 from the qatari red crescent .

further details on the reported shooting on monday in jerusalem ( see earlier ) : israeli police spokesman micky rosenfeld said it was a terrorist attack and that one victim , a man , had been taken to hospital for treatment .
police are searching for a suspect that fled the scene , rosenfeld said .
micky rosenfeld ( @ mickyrosenfeld ) police respond to shooting incident near wadi joz area in jerusalem .
one man injured moderately/seriously .
police looking into background .
seth frantzman ( @ sfrantzman ) if u want to understand where 2 alleged attacks in # jerusalem were today , here is a handy map i made of two sites
the guardian 's jason burke , in gaza , reports hearing a suspected air strike precisely at the close of the ceasefire window israel declared on monday .
jason burke ( @ burke jason ) bang on 5pm , end of ceasefire , and i just heard what sounded like an air strike north of # gaza city , poss naval shelling

documents.title: netanyahu : 'we have no intention of attacking the residents of gaza '
text: the israeli prime minister , binyamin netanyahu , said : we have no intention of attacking the residents of gaza '' during a visit to the military 's southern command headquarters , according to a statement released by the government press office .
the un estimates that 80 % of the 1,865 killed in gaza in the past month were civilians .
netanyahu is further quoted as saying that the gaza campaign is continuing : the campaign in gaza is continuing .
what is about to conclude is the idf action to deal with the tunnels but this operation will end only when quiet and security are restored to the citizens of israel for a lengthy period .
we struck a very severe blow at hamas and the other terrorist organisations .
we have no intention of attacking the residents of gaza .
in practice , it is hamas that is attacking them and denying them humanitarian aid .
i think that the international community needs to strongly condemn hamas and also demand , just as we are demanding , that the rehabilitation of gaza be linked to its demilitarisation .
netanyahu thanked military officials and soldiers and expressed his condolences to families of soldiers killed in action .
afp is now carrying some comments from the hamas delegation in cairo .
ezzat al-rishq said of the israel-less talks : the israeli side is trying to foil the meeting in cairo by violating the ( 72-hour ) truce .
whether the ( israeli ) delegation comes or not it will not run away from its responsibilities .
the palestinian people will pursue them at the icc ( international criminal court )

in cairo , meanwhile , representatives from hamas and islamic jihad have held their first formal meeting with egyptian mediators in talks aimed at securing a lasting ceasefire , but which do not , as yet , involve israel .
talks began at midday ( 10am bst ) and lasted about two hours , reuters said .
there was no immediate comment from the palestinian delegation .
reuters report another possible attack in jerusalem - emergency workers said someone riding a motorbike shot and wounded a man on a street in the city .
the circumstances of the incident were not immediately clear .
more on the earlier report that a british aid worker from rochdale has died in gaza .

the foreign office in london is urgently '' looking into reports that the man died in an israeli strike in rafah yesterday : we are aware of the reports of the death of a british national in rafah and are urgently looking into them .
israeli police stand guard at the scene after a palestinian man rammed an excavator into a jerusalem bus .
gharabli/afp/getty images here 's another photo of the aftermath of the apparent digger attack in jerusalem .
afp has more details on the apparent digger attack on a bus in jerusalem , saying that one person was killed , in addition to the digger driver , after being run over by the digger .
a police spokeswoman , luba samri , identified the victim as a 25-year-old ultra-orthodox jew resident in jerusalem and said the driver was a palestinian man from jabal mukaber in east jerusalem .
yossi pariente , from jerusalem police , told reporters at the scene : he hit a bus and turned it onto its side and as a result three people were lightly injured who were on the bus .
two police happened to be in the area they got out of their car and fired at the [ excavator ] and as a result [ the driver ] was killed .
the bus was almost empty at the time , pariente said .
zaki heller , a spokesman for emergency services in jerusalem , said : a 25-year-old man was run over by the excavator and killed , and the bus driver was moderately to lightly injured .
four other people were slightly hurt , he added .
my colleague jason burke has just sent this : just back in gaza city after driving to khuzaa , in the south of the strip and close to the israeli border .
it 's a small town , a village really , of farmers and has seen heavy fighting as well as bombardment in recent weeks .
it has only been accessible for a couple of days since the israeli troops pulled back .
in some houses you can find snacks , drinks , tins of tuna , the soldiers were eating .
there 's a lot of damage - to roads , streets , mosques and many buildings .
plenty of dead animals , livestock and so on .
people were trying to make there way back to their homes , or up belongings , but the situation is very unstable there .

jason burke ( @ burke jason ) another from khuzaa earlier today while # gaza ceasefire held one man was explaining how his son , a hamas fighter , has been killed in the village during combat with israeli troops , when we had to leave as fairly sustained shelling started at around 1pm .
impossible to say exactly what was being fired from where but it sounded like tank fire from israeli lines and seemed to be aimed at the northern edges of the village .
about 20 rounds had been fired by the time we left and there was no sign of the shelling letting up .
otherwise the town of khan younis was lively , lots of people out on the streets now , and more on the road back to gaza city , though still very , very quiet .
gaza city itself remains pretty much deserted though .
darshna soni ( @ darshnasoni ) reports that a british muslim aid worker , named as kadir islam from rochdale , was killed in gaza over the weekend .
this tweet comes from a reporter for britain 's channel 4 news .
as well as the heavy death toll , with more than 1,800 people killed so far within gaza , an estimated 9,000 others have been injured .

this afp story gives a grim of the extent of the injuries faced by many of these : lying on his bed in a gaza hospital , three-year-old yamin now sees the world from behind burns which have disfigured him for life .
the tiny boy is just one of hundreds of burn victims and those wounded by israeli shell fire overwhelming gaza 's sole working operating theatre for plastic surgeons .
he also has burns on his back and multiple fractures suffered when an israeli strike decimated his family and destroyed their home in al-buraj , central gaza , last week .
it was the evening .
the start of eid al-fitr , the festival marking the end of the muslim holy month of ramadan .
in a single strike , the house was turned to rubble and 19 people lay dead .
yamin , miraculously , was the sole survivor but he was left an orphan and badly burnt .

he was taken to a clinic then rapidly transferred to the burns department at the shifa hospital in gaza , where he cries , lying naked , and where a handful of surgeons are now confronted with the endless horrors of the war there are very few light injuries in this war , '' says ghassan abu sitta , a plastic surgeon from the american university of beirut , sent a week ago by the medical aid for palestinians ( map ) organisation to help out in gaza .
my feeling is around 70 % would have some kind of permanent deformity , either in terms of scarring or in terms of functional deformity they will never be the same again . ''
his worst case ?
an 8 year-old boy who basically lost half of his face including one eye and lost the other eye with shrapnel in .
what i needed to do is reconstruct the face just to cover the wounds .
the eyes are lost .
he lost all his family , his ability to care for himself has been completely destroyed .
there is no future for him , he keeps asking why they have turned the lights off . ''
israel says hamas has also violated today 's ceasefire - which , admittedly , was unilaterally declared by israel and not agreed by hamas - by firing rockets .
at least four rockets have been fired since the 10am start of the ceasefire , israel says , according to ap .
a bus in jerusalem overturned by a man driving a mechanical digger .
sultan/epa here 's a photo of the apparent attack that left several people injured in jerusalem , one seriously .
as you can see in the photo the vehicle used to topple the bus was a mechanical digger and not , as some early reports said , a tractor .

documents.title: summary
text: it 's just over four hours into israel 's self-declared seven-hour partial ceasefire in gaza , and this is where we are : palestinian officials have reported one apparent israeli strike after the ceasefire began at 10am ( 8am bst ) when a home in the coastal shati refugee camp was hit , killing a girl aged eight and injuring 29 others .
there has been no information from israel 's military .
gazans have been wary of the ceasefire - which does not extend into parts of rafa - and few people have seemingly ventured out .
a bus in jerusalem has been overturned by a man driving a digger or tractor , injuring several people .
israeli police described it as a terrorist attack , shooting dead the driver .

while peace talks ( not including israel ) continue in cairo , the leader of hamas , khaled meshaal , has reiterated his organisation 's belief that any lasting ceasefire depends on the blockade of gaza being lifted .

david cameron has said the un chief , ban ki-moon , was right '' to describe yesterday 's apparent israeli strike on a un school , which killed 10 people , as a moral outrage and a criminal act '' , but declined to say whether he thought it breached international law .
the foreign minister of france , laurent fabius , has suggested a peace deal should be imposed on israel and hamas if they can not agree .
the israeli newspaper haaretz has a photograph of the aftermath of the apparent attack on a bus by what it describes as a tractor .
the driver of the tractor was shot dead by police , it adds .
two people have been injured , one seriously , after someone rammed an excavator into an israeli bus in jerusalem , overturning the vehicle , according to various reports .
police called the incident a terrorist attack , '' indicating that they suspect palestinian involvement , ap reports .
palestinian attackers have carried out similar attacks using bulldozers in the past .
france 's foreign minister , laurent fabius , has today proposed the notion that the international community might need to impose a solution for gaza separately of israel and hamas .

in quotes described by ap as unusually strong '' for france , which has close ties to israel , fabius said israel 's right to security does not justify the killing of children and the massacre of civilians '' .

fabius added that a longer-term , two-state solution was needed , should be imposed by the international community because , despite numerous attempts , the two sides have shown themselves to be incapable of concluding negotiations '' .
my colleague , paddy allen , has put together this graphic showing the location of the shati refugee camp , where this morning 's presumed israeli air strike took place .
cnn has spoken to the qatar-based leader of hamas , khaled meshaal .
he 's not saying anything particularly new , reiterating that his organisation would agree to a long-term ceasefire if israel lifts its blockade of gaza .
he also denies that hamas uses gaza 's civilian population as human shields .
here 's some quotes , using cnn 's translation .
on human shields : it is unfortunate that the american administration and president obama have adopted the israeli narrative , which is a lie .
hamas sacrifices itself for its people and does not use its people as human shields to protect its soldiers .
the fighter , just the like the soldier in the army , his job is to protect the people , and not to sacrifice the people for himself .

on talks in cairo : regardless what the others ' positions ( are ) , we stated that we are ready to go as a palestinian delegation to cairo in order to talk to the egyptians so they can hold indirect talks between us and the israelis , so we can reach an agreement that will address our palestinian demands , headed by ending the siege of gaza .
then ceasefire can take place .
we announced this position before and we are still committed to it .

on a longer-term peace : there are two kinds of ceasefires : there is the humanitarian ceasefire , like 72-hour ceasefire that was meant to help and aid our people getting food , water , and help collecting the bodies .
as far as the sustainable ceasefire , this is connected to an agreement accepted by the two parties that will guarantee our palestinian demands headed by lifting the siege on gaza .
video of cnn interview with hamas leader khaled meshaal
palestinians hunt through the rubble of a building after an apparent israeli air strike at the shati refugee camp in gaza city .
o'reilly/reuters some more photos are coming in of the aftermath of this morning 's apparent israeli strike in gaza .
other photos show the body of a girl being removed , corroborating the reports that a child of eight was killed .
the palestinian deputy prime minister , mohammed mustafa , has told reuters that reconstruction in gaza following four weeks of fighting will cost at least $ 6bn ( £ 3.6bn ) .
mustafa noted that in 2009 following an earlier conflict an international aid conference for gaza pledged $ 5bn , but only a fraction of this money ever arrived .
he added : once a ceasefire is reached , we will have to tackle the immediate problem of rehousing those who lost their homes .
according to our estimates , they may number 400,000 people .

some of those who went to gaza 's shifa hospital following a presumed israeli missile strike on a home after the start of israel 's self-declared ceasefire , which palestinian officials said killed a young girl and injured 29 others .
abed/afp/getty images

reuters has more details on the apparent israeli strike on a house in the shati refugee camp in coastal gaza city , citing palestinian officials as saying it killed an eight-year-old girl and wounded 29 other people .
gaza 's health ministry said it took place after the unilateral israeli ceasefire began at 10am local time ( 8am bst ) .
there has been no response so far from the israeli military .
update via ap : the israeli military said it targeted an operative threat '' and rocket fire in the strike around 10 a.m . ''
smoke rises following an apparent israeli strike in gaza city .
fathi/nurphoto/rex smoke rises following an apparent israeli strike in gaza city .
fathi/nurphoto/rex these two photos purport to show the aftermath of this morning 's post-ceasefire strike in gaza .

israel 's foreign minister , avigdor lieberman , has suggested that control of gaza should be passed from the palestinian authority to the un , much like what happened in east timor and kosovo , the israeli newspaper haaretz reports on its live blog .
lieberman said : everyone is asking , what happens after the operation ends ?
suppose israel defeats hamas .
there are a few options .
international control of gaza , by the un , should certainly be considered .
we saw it works quite well there it requires an agreement between us and the palestinian authority .
it does n't require consent from the un , just from the parties involved - israel and the pa .
according to afp , this morning 's post-ceasefire strike on gaza , aimed at a house in the beachfront shati refugee camp , killed a child and injured 30 people .

my colleague harriet sherwood , who is in jerusalem , sends this about israel 's possible plans once the current assault is over : in an interview with army radio this morning , tzipi livni , a member of the security cabinet , said israel should consider building an underground fence around gaza to counter the threat from tunnels .
the conflict would not end with destroying the network of cross-border tunnels , she said .

we will have to create either an underground barrier , which is a primitive but effective [ solution ] , costly but worth the cost , or alternatively , technological measures , which may be less outmoded and could be effective . ''

david cameron has been equivocating a bit over his response to yesterday 's israeli strike on a un school in gaza , saying ban ki-moon was correct to describe the attack as a moral outrage and a criminal act '' but declining to endorse the language himself .
speaking on bbc breakfast cameron - who was yesterday criticised by the labour leader , ed miliband , for failing to openly condemn israel 's actions in gaza - was asked about ban 's language .

cameron said : i think the un is right to speak out in the way that it has , because international law is very clear that there must not be the targeting of civilians or the targeting of schools if that is what has happened .
the un as the international body is right to speak out in the way it has .

pressed on whether he , too , saw the attack as a criminal act '' , cameron replied : the un has spoken very clearly and i think they are right to speak very clearly i 'm not an international lawyer , so that 's up to international lawyers .
but international law is very , very clear that the use of force always has to be proportionate and civilians should not be targeted .
cameron said the government had been very clear that there needs to be an immediate comprehensive humanitarian ceasefire , that we want this conflict to stop '' .
he continued : we obviously do think it is appalling the loss of life that there has been .
from the start , though , we have also made the point that if the hamas rocket attacks on israel stop then that would be probably the fastest way to stop this conflict .

jason burke , who is in gaza city , sends this about the so far very limited impact of today 's israeli ceasefire : the unilateral ceasefire declared by the israelis met with a cool reaction in gaza this morning .
there was little sign of the sudden activity in the streets that friday 's agreed truce with hamas had brought .
fishing boats stayed in the port .
few people ventured out .
bombing and shelling in and around gaza city had continued overnight with rockets fired by hamas towards israel in the early morning .
this is unilateral .
there is no guarantee from the israelis .
i hope it holds but we 'll see , '' said hossam bkair , 20 , who had left his home to get his hair cut .
it makes no real difference .
perhaps i might have a chance to go and swim , '' said hamed abu hassira , 22 , a student .
i have n't been since the war started and i used to go every day .
maybe it 's a chance to get some food and just have a bit of relief . ''
omar tarabish , 28 , unemployed , said that he hoped something good would come out of [ the talks in ] cairo '' .
we all want safety and calm .
now for the first time we have all the different [ palestinian ] factions together and we will have one united decision .
all the keys are in the egyptian hands .
only they can solve it .
the egyptians are the friends of the arab people , '' tarabish said .
but he dismissed the israeli ceasefire as useless '' , saying : we 've had them before and you can see what happened in rafah '' .
ruth pollard ( @ rpollard ) reports of a strike on a house in shati camp in # gaza 15 mins after ceasefire .
at least 15 injured .
details still coming in .
more information about the apparent post-ceasefire strike on the house , from the correspondent for the sydney morning herald and age newspapers .
palestinian officials have already accused israel of breaching its own seven-hour ceasefire by bombing a house in gaza city , reuters reports .
the agency quoted a spokesman for gaza 's health ministry , ashraf al-qidra , as saying 15 people were wounded in the strike , mostly women and children .
an israeli military spokeswoman said she was checking the report , it added .

as our latest gaza news story notes , diplomatic efforts over gaza continued in cairo on sunday , including representatives from egypt , hamas and islamic jihad , as well as the middle east envoy tony blair and us special envoy frank lowenstein .
there was , however , no israeli representation , making any real breakthrough unlikely .

that said , a report in ahram online , the english-language arm of egypt 's biggest newspaper , said there was some progress between the palestinians and egyptians : a senior figure from islamic jihad has said that the unified demands of the palestinian delegation currently in cairo for ceasefire talks were received positively by the egyptian side on sunday evening .

the demands include immediate ceasefire and withdrawal of israeli forces from gaza , end to blockade of the territory and opening all border crossings for people and merchandise and the release of all palestinians detained by israel in the west bank since 12 june .

according to ziad nakhala , the deputy secretary-general of islamic jihad who represented his movement in today 's talks , things are moving in the right direction and the climate [ with the egyptian side ] has been positive '' .

the palestinian delegation , which consists of representatives of the palestinian authority , hamas , islamic jihad and other factions , convened in cairo on sunday and presented the egyptian side with a set of demands for a ceasefire agreement with israel , despite the latter 's boycott of the talks .
an american delegation is currently present in cairo for the negotiations .
according to nakhala , the palestinian delegation will resume its meeting with egyptian intelligence chief mohamed farid el-tohamy on monday , but progress has been made already .
we 're now half an hour into the israeli ceasefire , with no immediate word of any fighting .
hamas has expressed scepticism about the seven-hour halt , with a spokesman , sami abu zuhri , saying : we do not trust such a calm and call on our people to take caution .
according to ap , citing gaza police , israeli air raids overnight destroyed three mosques , nine houses , five seaside chalets and a warehouse for construction material .
according to the latest tallies on the live blog of the israeli newspaper haaretz at least four people were killed in gaza overnight , taking the overall toll to 1,807 .
the israeli military attacked more than 20 targets , it adds , with two militants ' tunnels destroyed over the past 24 hours .
on our comment site today we have a piece from paul mason , also from channel 4 news , where he is economics editor .
he has just returned from a week in gaza , which he says is a place which should be given a chance to thrive .
here 's an extract : i have been to muslim countries where there is deep conservatism , low education and sus of the west .
this is not one of them .
i constantly meet highly educated people who speak english ; cheerful and friendly people - which is amazing in itself , given the level of terror the night brings .
the world is not so blessed with educated , resourceful people that it can afford to waste the lives of 1.8 million palestinians behind the iron grilles and the concrete walls that delimit gaza .
i have lost track of how many times i 've met a young guy , 18 or 19 years old , proud not to be a fighter , a militant , or a duck-and-dive artist on the street .
when you ask what his job is , the common answer is carpenter '' .
working with wood - not metal or computer code - is the limit of what the blockade has enabled the skilled manual worker here to achieve .
faced with such hopelessness , naturally , many become resigned : living is the same as being dead '' is a phrase you hear among young men .
it is the perfect rationale for the nihilist military organisation some choose to join .
but its opposite is the resourcefulness that rewires a house after its front has been blown off ; that sits on the carpet making bread on a hot pan after a home has been reduced to dust .
lindsey hilsum ( @ lindseyhilsum ) heading to # mons # belgium for # ww1 centenary , thinking of how outcome is still being felt across the # middleeast .
# syria # gaza today 's other major news story is the centenary of the start of the first world war .
in this tweet channel 4 news 's international editor notes the connection between the two .
shortly before the ceasefire an israeli airstrike killed a leader from the radical group islamic jihad in gaza , ap reports .
the group , closely allied to hamas , said daniel mansour , its commander in the northern part of gaza , died when the strike hit his home just before dawn .
jason burke ( @ burke jason ) still outgoing rockets early this morning from # gaza city.some bombing strikes o/night .
israeli ceasefire to come into effect in 90 minutes .
this tweet from jason burke shows that attacks from both sides were continuing this morning in the runup to the truce .
here 's the latest story on events in gaza from my colleagues harriet sherwood and jason burke .
in it , they note that diplomatic efforts towards a longer peace seem no more advanced : despite the truce , the international community is likely to be alarmed at israel bypassing negotiations .
political leaders and senior diplomats have repeatedly stressed that the two sides must address and resolve underlying issues that led to the current conflict to break the cycle of violence .

efforts to forge a truce resumed in cairo on sunday , with middle east envoy tony blair and us special envoy frank lowenstein flying in , along with a palestinian delegation which included representatives of hamas and islamic jihad , the main militant groups in gaza .
israel declined to send a team to join the talks , , an indication that it wants to proceed on its own terms , diminishing prospects for an early breakthrough .

among demands tabled by the palestinians were an end to the blockade of gaza , extending the permitted fishing zone at sea and the removal of the no-go buffer zone inside the border , as well as the rehabilitation of gaza , emergency aid and a release of prisoners .

here 's a brief summary of where things are , four weeks into the gaza conflict : in about half an hour a partial seven-hour military halt will begin , unilaterally imposed by israel to allow humanitarian aid to reach gaza and for people to briefly return to their homes .
it will not apply to areas of rafah , israel says , because its forces remain on the ground there to destroy a cross-border tunnel .
the pause in the israeli offensive comes as the country 's ground operations in gaza are being gradually scaled back .
it comes a day after an attack on a united nations school sheltering palestinian civilians killed at least 10 people , following the shelling of two other un schools .
in an unusually strong condemnation of israel the us said it was appalled by the disgraceful '' school attack , while the un chief , ban ki-moon , called it a moral outrage and a criminal act '' .
the palestinian death toll has passed 1,750 , 80 % of whom are civilians , according to un estimates .
about 460,000 people have been displaced .
among israelis , 66 have died , among them two civilians , and a thai national working in the country .
